page1.title: Bucket List
page1.description: After receiving a heart transplant, a 40-year-old housewife in Pune makes the life-changing decision to complete the bucket list of her 20-year-old organ donor.

page1.title: Tujha Tu Majha Mi
page1.description: When two young rebels, Jay & Rajashree decide to chase their dreams, a serious of dramatic situations erupt. Will they break, or will they rise?

page1.title: Karaar
page1.description: The film takes a look at what happens when people begin to live their lives on the basis of formal agreements registered in courts.

page1.title: The Silence
page1.description: Traveling on a Mumbai local, Chini witnesses a woman being molested. This incident triggers a bad memory from her childhood that comes haunting back to her.  A critically acclaimed true story!!

page1.title: Chitthi
page1.description: A rom-com that revolves around the confusion caused by a misplaced love letter.

page1.title: Dhol Taashe
page1.description: The story is about Amey, who works in IT, but loses his job due to a recession. After losing the job Amey involves himself in a group of "Dhol Taashe" playing artiste who plays the instrument for the culture of the same and not money.

page2.title: Fugay
page2.description: Recently engaged Aditya, along with his best friend, Hrishikesh, goes to Goa to celebrate bachelorhood before getting married. Soon, their celebration turns out to be their worst nightmare as they end up being photographed as gay couples.

page2.title: Baapjanma
page2.description: Bhaskar Pandit, a retired man, is content with his daily routine. But his cancer diagnosis changes things and suddenly, there’s so much that Bhaskar wants to sort out in life. A critically acclaimed family drama!!

page2.title: Bhikari
page2.description: A remake of Tamil film Pichaikkaran (2016) revolves around a young businessman who is forced to live the life of a beggar to cure his ailing mother and in the process faces various problems.

page2.title: Family Katta
page2.description: A splintered family reunites for the parents' golden anniversary. Will things go as planned? Or will new challenges and old problems resurface? An emotional family drama!!

page2.title: Zindagi Virat
page2.description: Santosh is still coming to terms with his father’s demise when his father’s ghost starts haunting him with a strange request- that of celebrating its birthday.  A super hit family drama!!

page2.title: Hello ! Gandhe Sir
page2.description: Mr. Gandhe is a person who personifies discipline; being ruthless he runs his college like an autocrat, not realizing he is shattering the tender dreams in the eyes of his students.

page3.title: Jogwa
page3.description: The base of the movie is about the DEVDASI tradition in southern Maharashtra & Karnataka. Devdasis are people who have to sacrifice their whole life in devotion & service of God.Winner of five national film awards for 2008.

page3.title: Khulyancha Bazar
page3.description: Khulyancha Bazar is a movie directed by S.M. Ranjan	featuring Alka Kubal, Vijay Chauhan.

page3.title: Kutumb
page3.description: A poor man, who strives to keep his family happy, finds himself in a dilemma when his wife falls ill and he has to raise the money required for her surgery. A family drama!!

page3.title: Mi Amruta Boltey
page3.description: Mi Amruta Boltey is a Drama Marathi movie, directed by Samruddhi Jadhav, starring Madhura Velankar-Satam, Rajesh Shringarpure, Pradeep Velankar, Madhu Kambikar along with others.

page3.title: Paradh
page3.description: The movie is based on the power of politics and how an innocent family gets caught in the crossfire of lies and deceit. A popular political drama!!

page3.title: Ringa Ringa
page3.description: The story deals with Rangarao who is all set to become the Chief Minister of Goa despite his involvement with terrorist outfits.  A crime thriller!!

page4.title: Aadharstambh
page4.description: Terrorism and chaos seem to be the order of the day. Only a few valiant and honest men stand between chaos and stability. When politicians join hands with terrorists for selfish ends, there is no saying where events will take us.

page4.title: Aga Bai Arecha
page4.description: Loosely based on the Hollywood film What Women Want, The film highlights the life and the problems of a common man living in a metropolitan city like Mumbai. A comedy entertainer!!

page4.title: Aika Dajiba
page4.description: Mukta Barve and Priya Bapat are Dajiba`s sister in laws, who falls in love with a grocer`s son and a Punjabi boy. Dajiba`s wife being a conservative and orthodox lady is opposed to their relationship. A comedy movie!!

page4.title: Fakta Ladh Mhana
page4.description: The story revolves around a gang who consists of Tukaram, Westindies, a dark guy, Kanphatya, who has hearing problems, a Salim, Alex, an aggressive guy, Paani Cum a small boy and Baba Bhai leader of the gang.One of the costliest Marathi Action film!!

page4.title: Saha September
page4.description: A 2007 Marathi movie starring Pallavi Subash, Vijay Patkar. Directed by Raja Chitra

page4.title: Sanai Choughade
page4.description: The movie is a light-hearted family entertainer full of twists and turns which forces everyone to inspect the conventional arranged marriage system. A popular rom-com!!

page5.title: Shahanpan Dega Deva
page5.description: The plot of the movie is a comical ride as the city’s safety rests on the shoulders of 5 lunatics from a mental asylum.

page5.title: Swarajya Marathi Paul Padate Pudhe
page5.description: Ram Pathare dreams of starting his own business. Lack of accountability of the local MLA Mohan Kapadia he goes a step further and launches his own political party.

page5.title: Tingya
page5.description: The movie is based on a life of a rural boy and his love and friendship with his bull. It concentrates on the hardships faced by the farmers in the state of Maharashtra, India.Child artist (Sharad Geokar) won the National Film Award for Best Child Artist.

page5.title: Yanda Kartavya Aahe
page5.description: The movie is based on a newlywed couple’s honeymoon and the psychological and physical union of a married couple.A popular rom-com!!

page5.title: Kanika
page5.description: A doctor and his colleagues, who conducted unethical testing on patients, face retribution from a supernatural victim.

page5.title: Muramba
page5.description: When a couple breaks their three-year relationship that was fraught with issues and conflict, the boy's parents intervene and try to reunite them, despite the boy's disapproval of their interference.

page6.title: Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai
page6.description: A girl from Mumbai who comes to Pune to meet a prospective groom, with the idea of rejecting him, ends up spending the day with a complete stranger.

page6.title: Sachin : A Billion Dreams
page6.description: A tale of a small boy with dreams and his journey to becoming the God of Cricket and the most celebrated sportsperson in his country. A docudrama-biographical film!! (Marathi Dubbed)

page6.title: Bharat Aala Parat
page6.description: A politician and popular social worker is a trustee of a hospital, but power is his weakness. His nephew comes to serve there and realizes that the institution is not what it should be, so he decides to teach his uncle a lesson.

page6.title: Dhanya Wagh
page6.description: Dhanya Wagh is a Marathi movie directed by Satish Patil and featured Satish Sathe, Sushant Patil and Prakash Dhotre as lead characters.

page6.title: Sawaal Majha Aika
page6.description: Sawaal Majha Aika! is a Marathi Indian black and white film released in 1964. The film is produced and directed by Anant Govind Mane under his own banner "Chetana Chitra".

page6.title: Savalee
page6.description: Sanika is daughter of famous classical singer Ramabai Shorodkar.Sanika develops hate for being compared with her mother or taken for granted as Ramabai's daughter. Later, she quits her home and joins an orchestra group.

page8.title: Pachhadlela
page8.description: Three friends move into a town where their office gives them a mansion to live in, which is haunted by ghosts. One of the friends is possessed by four ghosts resulting in hilarious misunderstandings until the truth is revealed.

page8.title: Mukta
page8.description: Mukta is the story of an upper caste girl and a lower caste boy who struggle against the contradictions of their caste, both in India as well as among a community of Indians who have settled abroad, in a supposedly liberated environment.

page8.title: Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai 2
page8.description: A sequel to the 2010 film 'Mumbai-Pune-Mumbai', this one revolves around the marriage preparation of the lead protagonists.

page8.title: Me Shivajiraje Bhosale Boltoy
page8.description: A man always complains that Marathi people have lost their identity in Mumbai. This provokes Shivaji Maharaj's spirit; it reprimands this man for his shallow thinking and encourages doing something good to bring back the Marathi pride.

page8.title: Masala
page8.description: The story of couple who move from town to town, city to city due to failure in business and afraid of facing people to whom they owe money they took for business.The film is loosely based on the life story of Hukmichand Chordia of Pravin Masalewale fame.

page8.title: Lai Bhaari
page8.description: Sumitra travels to Pandharpur to find a ray of hope, after Sangram killed her husband and son and took over their business.The film became the highest grossing Marathi film of the time.

page9.title: Jawai Maaza Bhala
page9.description: This NATAK is based on a what a father goes through just before his daughter is about to get married.It was written by Ratnakar Matkari, directed by Adwait Dadarkar and presented by KalaShri Boston.

page9.title: Ek Gaon Barah Bhangadi
page9.description: Ek Gaav Bara Bhangadi is a Drama marathi movie, directed by Anant Mane, starring Arun Sarnaik, Dada Salvi, Jayshree Gadkar, Nilu Phule along with others.

page9.title: Doghi
page9.description: Gauri and Krishna are daughters of poor hard working parents. Gauri's husband dies on the day of the wedding stigmatizing her for life. Her mother persuades her city based brother to take her away to Mumbai. She goes into prostitution to earn her living.

page9.title: Ek Hota Vidushak
page9.description: Aburao is a famous clown in Tamasha world, but will be soon addicted to the world of fame.The film portrays the life of folk theater artist and is considered as one of the few films made on the life of "tamasha" artistes.

page9.title: Chintoo
page9.description: A boy and his friends spend their summer vacation playing cricket on a barren piece of land. Their fun is interrupted when a local tough sets up a food stall on the same piece of land.

page9.title: Bharatiya
page9.description: Abhay returns to Adnide, the remote village of his birth and finds that nothing has really changed. He wants to rediscover his identity and work towards social betterment, but encounters conflicts, obstacles and irritants.

page10.title: Bangarwadi
page10.description: A teacher finds a village where the school isn't functional, and parents don't want to send their children there. He gains the support of the village head and convinces the local people to send their children. Disaster follows.

page10.title: Balak-Palak
page10.description: Four teenagers learn a friend has left the colony and brought disgrace to her family. They do not believe their parent's explanations and decide to find out what her disgraceful act was.

page10.title: Aata Pita
page10.description: The protagonist embarks on a journey to pursue his ultimate dream.Aata Pita is a Marathi film, released on 10 December 2010. The film has been produced by Twenty First Century Entertainment and directed by Uttung Shelar.

page10.title: Ventilator
page10.description: Family members gather together at the hospital to say their farewells to their patriarch. A critically acclaimed comedy drama produced by Priyanka Chopra!!

page10.title: Vastupurush
page10.description: It is about Bhaskar, who rises above his poor financial conditions and devotes himself to the poor people for his mother believes that their generations have been cursed by the Vastupurush for doing wrong to people of lower castes.

page10.title: Fandry
page10.description: Jabya, an untouchable teenager in India, falls in love with Shalu, a classmate from a higher caste.

page12.title: And Jara Hatke
page12.description: Sometimes love blooms once again at the most unlikely stages of ones life. These are stories that are a little bit, exceptional. And Jara Hatke is one such story.

page12.title: Janiva
page12.description: Janiva, which means realization, is the story of a young boy, Sameer Deshpande, who is very sensitive and believes in being charitable and helping others. Can you take law in your hands to give justice to a victim you don't know?

page12.title: Rangaa Patangaa
page12.description: Rangaa Patangaa is the story of Jumman, played by Makarand Anaspure who is a farmer from the Vidarbha region of Maharashtra. The movie focuses on the changing situations that affect Jumman's life and work.

page12.title: Sugar Salt Ani Prem
page12.description: Sugar Salt Aani Prem, a film based on the relationship shared between 3 women looking for their respective paths of life. With a slice of life feeling to it, it is a film which will give u a taste of relations, friendship and life!

page12.title: Baghtos Kay Mujra Kar
page12.description: Nanasaheb Deshmukh, the head chief of a village that adjoins a magnificent – but now neglected – fort from Shivaji’s time.The film is about the politics surrounding the fort and Nanasaheb’s attempt to achieve his goals to restore the fort.

page12.title: Coffee Ani Barach Kahi
page12.description: What happens when two young people meet and start liking each other? Somebody takes initiative, express the feelings and then if both feel the same, and they click. However, what happens when Jaai and Nishad meets is a comedy of errors.

page13.title: Babanchi Shala
page13.description: Babanchi Shala is a film that deals with the lives of the inmates languishing in jail cells and the unjust treatment meted out to their loved ones by the society.

page13.title: YZ
page13.description: YZ is a coming-of-age comedy about a 33-year-old who is trapped between the identity of a boy and a man.

page13.title: Gulmohar
page13.description: Deven, an achiever, and competent young man are married to Vidya who has loved him for whatever he was and whatever he wants to be. Yet the pace and anxiety of the city life with its unending demands takes a toll on their relationship.

page13.title: Jatra
page13.description: Two villages compete bitterly for the chance to host a religious fair. To determine who gets to host, it is decided that one representative from both villages will race against each other.

page13.title: Kunku
page13.description: Kunku is a 1937 Marathi classic social drama film directed by V. Shantaram, and based on the novel, Na Patnari Goshta by Narayan Hari Apte, who also wrote film’s screenplay. The film was also released in Hindi as Duniya Na Mane.

page14.title: Sumbaran
page14.description: It is a story of old vs new, traditional vs modern and the decisions of a family to sticks with their old norms or adapts with the contemporary ones.Two brothers walk down memory lane, reminiscing about when they were young.

page14.title: Khel Saat Baracha
page14.description: The movie is about political and social conditions and experiences from the Indian political world.The movie has been shot on the current political situation.

page14.title: Online Binline
page14.description: Two guys, both poles apart in character, fall in love with the same girl but who will she choose?It stars Siddharth Chandekar, Rutuja Shinde and Hemant Dhome in lead.

page14.title: Duniyadari
page14.description: A few college friends help their friends, and one couple in love get married. They soon find out that the guy is suffering from terminal illness. Years later, they meet at their usual hang-out and remember the good times and their friends.

page14.title: Kaydyacha Bola
page14.description: Two engineering students, lie to their parents and land up in Bombay to have fun for a couple of days. Unfortunately, they get caught up in such a mess with the law that they can't find a way out.

page14.title: Bebhan
page14.description: Bebhan Marathi Movie Online - Jyoti Chandekar, Sachin Deshpande, Kunal Limaye, Manoj Kolhatkar, Mangesh Desai, Vasudha Deshpande and Shashikant Gandhe. Directed by Rajendra Bade. Music by Mithilesh Patankar

page15.title: Pahili Sher, Dusri Savvasher, Navara Pavsher
page15.description: It’s a story portraying Pandu’s struggle to maintain peace in his family. Pandu is happily married to Kamala. However, because Kamala could not give him a child, Pandu decides to marry another woman, Malkin.

page15.title: Double Seat
page15.description: Double Seat is a story of newlywed lovebirds Amit and Manjiri struggling to find their private space in the overwhelming city of Mumbai.An unusual love story!

page15.title: Sairat
page15.description: In interior Maharashtra, a fisherman's son and a local politician's daughter fall in love against the restrictions of caste hierarchy.

page15.title: Lokmanya: Ek Yug Purush
page15.description: A biographical,historical film based on the life events of legendary freedom Leader Lokymanya Baal Gangadhar Tilak.

page15.title: Premachi Goshta
page15.description: What happens when two strangers who share their views on love and marriage, get to know each other. A story of two people who meet at the family court, when they`re on the verge of divorce.

page15.title: Sinhasan
page15.description: Sinhasan is 1979 Marathi political drama film directed by Dr. Jabbar Patel. and written by journalist Vijay Tendulkar. The film is based on novel of the same name by writer and freelance journalist Arun Sadhu.

page16.title: Shejari
page16.description: Shejari is a Drama marathi movie, directed by V. Shantaram, starring Keshavrao Date, Gajanan Jagirdar, Jayshree, Chandrakant along with others.

page16.title: Shantata! Court Chalu Aahe
page16.description: It is set as a play-within-a-play, where a  amateur theatre group, makes an unscheduled stop at a village. There to pass time the cast members stage a mock trial, of a fellow cast member, Miss LeelaBenare, who had earlier aborted a child to keep her honour.

page16.title: Shala
page16.description: Set in the 70's in rural India, four 9th grade kids were writing their destiny. Joshi (14) is madly in love with Shirodkar (14) a beautiful Indian looking girl. Both study in the same class. The age old question "What is love anyway?"

page16.title: Savarkhed Ek Gaon
page16.description: Villagers are living in fear as strange things are happening everyday. Later they discover there are some unknown people behind this, who operate only in the dark. Who are these people and what is their motive?

page16.title: Satrangi Re
page16.description: The movie revolves around the world of a group of friends in their final year of graduation.  Satrangi Re depicts those emotional moments in the lives of the youth, moments that everyone will relate to, would love to cherish.

page16.title: Sarivar Sari
page16.description: Sarivar Sari was released in 2005. The movie has been produced by Lata Narvekar along with Bharti Achrekar and directed by Gajendra Ahire. The plot of the movie is based on a young woman's emotional journey freedom in a traditional society.

page17.title: Sant Dnyaneshwar
page17.description: Sant Dnyaneshwar is a 1940 film about the life of Jñāneśvar, a 13th-century Marathi poet, philosopher, sant and yogi of the Nath tradition.

page17.title: Sakshatkara
page17.description: Marathi Movie Sakshatkar (2004) Starring Varsha Usgaonkar, Ankush Choudhary, Aishwarya Narkar, Vijay Chauhan, Ashok Shinde, Suhasini Deshpande, Mangesh Desai, Sharad Ponkshe.

page17.title: Sail
page17.description: A loving couple get busy with their work lives and fall apart. After their divorce, the son stays with the mother, and the daughter, with the father. Then the son dies and the man encounters his ex-wife, whose life is in danger.

page17.title: Sagla Karun Bhagle
page17.description: In Bhokarwadi a young man, ‘Arjun’ (Makarand Anaspure) starts making efforts to eradicate alcoholism from his village but uses different methods to achieve success in this noble thought.

page17.title: Saatchya Aat Gharat
page17.description: A group of young boys and girls grapple with moral issues in a changing world.

page17.title: Rita
page17.description: Rita is a woman who is forced to give up on her dreams at the tender age of 17, and make a drastic compromise for the future of her family. Without pause, she takes stock of her reality and thrusts herself into the life of a more mature woman.

page18.title: Ranbhool
page18.description: Ranbhool is the story of a struggling musician, who gets on a killing rampage when he is rejected by music companies one too many times.

page18.title: Ramshastri
page18.description: Based on the life of Ramshastri Prabhune (1720-1789), the legendary chief justice at the court of Peshwa Madhavrao.

page18.title: Pathlaag
page18.description: Pathlaag is a Drama, Suspense marathi movie, directed by Raja Paranjape, starring Bhavna, Kashinath Ghanekar, Raja Nene, Vasant Latkar along with others.

page18.title: Pangira
page18.description: The story of ‘Pangira’ is all about how rapidly Indian villages have changed, over a period of time. Old rural hospitality and contented, peaceful village life – is now a History! Right from natural resources to local politics – ‘Indian village’ has changed.

page18.title: Nashibachi Aishi Taishi
page18.description: The story is about a simpleton Ravi, who stays along with his widowed mother, in a small house. He faces many social, economical and emotional problems in life. One day he shockingly discovers that his palm has absolutely no destiny lines.

page18.title: Narbachi Wadi
page18.description: A greedy landlord tries to take over a beautiful grove in Konkan from its rightful ancestral owner.

page19.title: Mumbaicha Dabewala
page19.description: Nama is a young, hardworking Dabewala in Mumbai. He diligently does his job of reaching lunch boxes to various people at offices. One such customer is a young lottery seller named Hema and soon, love blossoms between the two.

page19.title: Mokala Shwaas
page19.description: The film revolves around the head of the family Eknath Jagtap, who has 3 grown up daughters.He is an experienced salesman in a reputed Saree shop and is very much desperate to have a son.

page19.title: Mitwaa
page19.description: The story of ‘Mitwaa’ is set in the backdrop of Goa and revolves around three main characters.A love triangle between a rich businessman, his dearest friend, and an employee.

page19.title: Mission Possible
page19.description: Yash rejects the advances of his friend Sai when a new girl Pearl steps into their college. Yash falls for Pearl and they start dating each other. What Yash doesn't know is that Pearl is only pretending to be in love with him.

page19.title: Matichya Chuli
page19.description: The movie is a humorous portrayal of the archetypal relationship between a mother-in-law and daughter-in-law.

page19.title: Mast Challay Aamcha
page19.description: A father-in-law who is a bank manager and his son-in-law who drives an auto rickshaw have a love and hate relationship and each of them pretends to be better than the other.

page20.title: Maratha Tituka Melvava
page20.description: This movie is based on Shahaji Maharaj. Film StarsAlhad, Kashinath Ghanekar, Chandrakant Gokhale. and Sulochana Latkar. Directed by Bhalji Pendharkar

page20.title: Manthan
page20.description: ‘Manthan’ ek amrut pyala is based on an emotional journey of all the characters of different social strata through the eyes of Anjali Deshpande (Padmini Kolhapure) our main protagonist.

page20.title: Manoos
page20.description: Manoos, also called Life's for Living, is a 1939 Indian Marathi social melodrama film directed by V. Shantaram. The movie then remade in Hindi as Aadmi. The film was based on a short story called "The Police Constable".

page20.title: Mala Gheun Chala
page20.description: A 1988 Marathi movie starring Dada Kondke, Madhu Kambikar, Mohan Kothiwan, Dilip Kulkarni, Tejashree and directed by Dada Kondke.

page20.title: Lagna Pahave Karun
page20.description: NRI Nishant's fiancee breaks up their arranged match when he loses his job in the US. Furious, he insults the head of the marriage bureau. He meets Aditi and they set up their own matrimonial agency based on modern principles.

page21.title: Lalbaug Parel
page21.description: The plot of the movie is based on the original script of Jayant Pawar, which highlights the consequences of the atrocities towards the mill workers, totally ignored by the Government. The film is a story of a family of mill workers in Mumbai.

page21.title: Kumari Gangubai Metric
page21.description: The story revolves around a politician played by Nagesh Bhosle, who wants power at any cost. Gangubai, who is fighting for the rights of people in her village meets him and he decides to use her as a pawn in his quest for power.

page21.title: Kshanbhar Vishranti
page21.description: This is the story of four young couples who share a strong bond of friendship, with different dreams and aspirations and find love amidst themselves. In today's hectic world, what everyone really needs is a moment of respite.

page21.title: Khel Mandala
page21.description: From the director of `Gojiree` & `Tee Ratra` comes the story of a man struggling between Fantasy and Reality, Happiness and Pain, battling with this unreal world... `Khel Maandala`

page21.title: Kashala Udyachi Baat
page21.description: Aditya has no time for anything but his work. He neglects his family, prompting his wife to walk out on him. Aditya awakes to find himself stuck in an eternal Sunday! Only the advice of a mysterious, blind stranger can help him make sense of it all.

page21.title: Irada Pakka
page21.description: Rohit and Adhya are happily married and in order to break the monotony in life, they decide to play a game; little knowing that destiny had something else in store for them. A game in which unprecedented events take a different turn.

page22.title: Ideachi Kalpana
page22.description: Jayram is an upcoming struggling actor who is slated for greatness or at least his sister Jaywanti thinks so. Her husband Manohar is a lawyer. But he is a fraud.One has to count the fingers of one's hand after shaking hands with him.

page22.title: Hyancha Kahi Nem Nahi
page22.description: Jewellery shop owners brother Heere and Moti and many others are held hostage inside their shop by a shooter who has hold them on gun point from a opposite building.

page22.title: Happy Journey
page22.description: A man comes home when his sister dies, and realizes that he has missed her life, and in many ways his own. He will literally be haunted by his loving sibling until he makes the journey back to happiness.

page22.title: Haapus
page22.description: A story about one family from a village where the young son of an astrologer wants to break the vicious circle of the mango-farmers getting peanuts from a rich business man who earns millions in the market.

page22.title: Golmaal
page22.description: Golmaal is a story of a four guys trying to get a girl. The hero falls in love with a beautiful girl. His friend is also in love with the same girl. Both decide to do separate efforts to get the girl.

page22.title: Goshta Choti Dongraevadhi
page22.description: A recent college graduate returns to his village and discovers that his friend, a struggling farmer, is burdened by heavy debt.

page23.title: Superstar
page23.description: Baja (Pandharinath Kamble) and Ranga (Siddharth Jadhav) are two friends sharing passion for Tamasha (rural theatre). Tamasha is the legacy of their mothers, who had in their time initiated this art form in their village of Parambi.

page23.title: Gharandaaz
page23.description: Actors: Alka Kubal, Prashant Damle Directed by: Bhaskar Jadhav

page23.title: Gaon Tasa Changla (2008)
page23.description: The villagers are not interested in any development. One day a 75-year-old retired school Teacher arrives in the village to start the school.Initially, no one responds to his call and so he decides to leave. But things change dramatically.

page23.title: Gandha
page23.description: An ensemble of three independent stories is bound together by characters, who are going through experiences involving the senses of smell.

page23.title: Gammat Jammat
page23.description: This movie is famous for the song "Ashwini Ye Na" sung by legendary Bollywood singer-actor Kishore Kumar and for the large-screen debut of actress Varsha Usgaonkar.

page23.title: Gallit Gondhal Dm
page23.description: Kolsewadi always has bickering and fights between a politician and the head of the village. A villager uses the situation to his advantage by encouraging village folks to contest the elections, and an American artist helps.

page24.title: Gaiir (2009)
page24.description: The plot of the movie revolves around 2 people who look alike and the pursuit of the newly wed wife of one of these men to find about the other.

page24.title: Father Majha God Father
page24.description:
Super Hit Comedy Marathi Drama Father Majha Godfather
Starring: Sanjivani Jadhav, Machindra Kambli
Director: Shirish Rane, Producer: Jayesh Vira

page24.title: Elizabeth Ekadashi (2014)
page24.description: Dnyanesh is given a bicycle named Elizabeth by his father before he passes away. His family is poor and on the eve of Ashadhi, his mother is forced to sell Elizabeth to a pawn-shark. Dnyanesh and his group of friends try to recover Elizabeth.

page24.title: Ekulti Ek
page24.description: The film is the story of a very popular playback singer Arun Deshpande, who has separated from his wife Nandini and daughter Swara to further his musical career. It leads him to a rather lonely life with just his secretary Mehta and singer friend Madhura.

page24.title: Dr. Prakash Baba Amte
page24.description: Biopic on Dr. Prakash Amte, the selfless doctor and social worker who devoted his life towards the development and upliftment of the tribal people in the forests of western Maharashtra.

page24.title: Dahavi Fa
page24.description: Kids from class 10 'F' realized that they are the victims of brutal discrimination. They were not willing to accept tags like goons or thugs. Frustrated with the situation, these kids decide to take matters in their own hands.

page25.title: Deool
page25.description: Keshya, a simple villager believes that god has arrived in his village but everyone disbelieves him. Later when the politics plays its part things take a drastic change.

page25.title: Davpech
page25.description: Two friends Nilkanth and Vyankat go to Phulgaon village to participate in a unique game in return of huge sum of money.

page25.title: Checkmate
page25.description: This is a story of three guys who get duped of crores of rupees in an effort to double money. They somehow reach the suspect, use their smartness, intelligence and trickery to make multiple moves like in chess in an effort to get their money back.

page25.title: Chhatrapati Shivaji
page25.description: Chhatrapati Shivaji is a Action, Drama marathi movie, directed by Bhalji Pendharkar, starring Chandrakant, Gajanan Jagirdar, Baburao Pendharkar, Altekar along with others.

page25.title: Char Divas Premache
page25.description: Char Divas Premache explores the true meaning of love through a series of relationships starting from a misunderstood childhood romance. A Marathi Natak (play) directed by Waman Kendre and written by Ratnakar Matkari.

page25.title: Chalu Navra Bholi Bayako
page25.description: Chalu Navra Bholi Bayko is a Comedy marathi movie, directed by Anil Mohile, starring Bharat Jadhav, Ashok Saraf, Kishori Ambiye, Sulbha Deshpande along with others.

page26.title: Be Dune Saade Chaar
page26.description: A man has 2 wives and one does not know about the other. The film shows the funny situations that arise with the man as a result of this.

page26.title: Bakula Namdev Ghotale
page26.description: Wicked Ghotale has all the villagers under debts. Newly married Namdev brings home his pretty wife Bakula.Ghotales evil desires for Bakula.

page26.title: Baji
page26.description: It is an action-adventure-romance laced superhero vigilante film that transcends both folklore and present day. It is based on the legend of a man who took upon himself to protect the common man against oppression and injustice.

page26.title: Bayko Maheri Jate
page26.description: A 1963 Marathi movie starring Raja Paranjape, Sachin Pilgaonkar. Directed by Raja Paranjape.

page26.title: Badha
page26.description: A Strange incident occurs in the village. An only son of the family disappears and while the grandmother needs a boy in the family to attain salvation after death.The film is a compassionate story of a woman accused of witchcraft.

page26.title: Baburao La Pakda
page26.description: Baburao La Pakda is the story of a landlord named Baburao who is on the run with his friend's sister Chameli & his money as well. Comedy ensues when the contract killer hired to locate Baburao finds him & Chameli in Bangkok.

page28.title: Uladhaal
page28.description: A thief steals a heritage shield from his village; he is pursued by the villagers to Goa where the deal to sell the shield is supposed to happen.

page28.title: Zenda
page28.description: It talks about politics and youth. All youngsters, regardless of the level of society they belong to, are helpless in front of the bureaucracy.Two young politicians cannot see eye to eye, resulting in the split of a political party into two factions.

page28.title: Amar Bhoopali
page28.description: Veteran director V. Shantaram spins this biopic about poet and musician Honaji Bala - best know for popularizing the lavani dance form and for writing the classic raga Ghanashyam sundara shirdhara, who reached the zenith of his creative powers.

page28.title: Agadbam
page28.description: Paru, who despite having proper sight, is a victim of blind faith. Apart from being a possessive mother she keeps arguing with her son regarding marriage.Raiba is ready to tie the knot with any girl but his aspirations are very high.

page28.title: Aayna Ka Bayna
page28.description: Nine youngsters in a home for juvenile delinquents take a dance therapy course to escape from their bleak lives. The boys escape from their tyrannical warden to participate in a competition to show their special gift.

page28.title: Aaicha Gondhal
page28.description: A story of a dynamic woman, who likes her village a lot.She likes it so much that she will go to any extent to make sure that the village & the villagers living in it are doing fine. She also wants her son to be just like her.

page29.title: Aaram Haram Aahe
page29.description: Aaram Haram Aahe is a Marathi movie released on 26 October 1976. The movie was produced by Prem Chitra and directed by Kamlakar Torne. The plot is based on how a spoilt son who has everything in life picks up after his father dies.

page29.title: Aajcha Divas Majha
page29.description: An ordinary citizen and an honest political representative take on corruption and bureaucracy.When he accuses an IAS officer played by Mahesh Manjrekar of malpractice, he lands himself in a soup which even puts threatens his position.

page29.title: 72 Miles
page29.description: The film is set in the time of 50's and 60's about journey of a 13 year old young boy who ran away from his hostel and how this young boy matures with time when he meets a lady and her kids.

page29.title: Daagdi Chaawl
page29.description: A simple man Surya is living a peaceful middle class life but an incident forces him to join hands with criminal forces.

page29.title: Bokya Satbande
page29.description: "Bokya Satbande" is a naughty & mischievous seven-year-old boy. Once while playing cricket he accidentally hits the ball into an old couple’s - the "Belwandi's" apartment. The old couple take an immediate liking for this mischievous but honest little boy.

page29.title: Dhoom 2 Dhamaal
page29.description: Kunal and Rahul are fed up of their lives and try to commit suicide but in vain instead they fall in the trap of underworld Don Dadasaheb. To escape from him the only option they have is to protect Madhura daughter of Dadasaheb, from the rivals.

page30.title: Poshter Girl
page30.description: Rupali, an aspiring agricultural officer, is shocked when she comes to know that there are no females in the village and the villagers are giving up on farming.

page30.title: Asa Mi Tasa Mi
page30.description: Mohan is a simple villager who works with his family in the village hospital. He is an exceptionally gifted man just not where looks are concerned. To utilize this gift he has to change his appearance which happens accidentally.

page30.title: Natsamrat
page30.description: After he retires, an aging theatre actor and his wife begin to feel unwanted by their children.

page30.title: Poshter Boyz
page30.description: The life of three men when their photos appear on an advertisement for sterilization.

page30.title: Classmates
page30.description: The film revolves around a group of students studying in TYBA in 1995. Packed with the spirit of youth, this film is homage to the best years of our lives.The film is an official remake of 2006 Malayalam film, with the same name.

page30.title: Bhootacha Honeymoon
page30.description: A ghost haunts a village and harbours a desire to get married. Shankar Jagdale is a teacher who’s come on transfer to a village school. He is unaware that the village is haunted and no marriage or birth has taken place there in many years.

page32.title: Aga Bai Arechyaa 2
page32.description: A middle aged woman named shubha leads a mysterious life of her own and to know more about it an author named vikram meets her. After listening to her, he is thoroughly shocked

page32.title: Court
page32.description: The apparent 'suicide' of a sewage cleaner leads to the arrest of Dalit activist/folk singer. The 65-year old is held on grounds of abetting the suicide through his lyrics. The film follows the personal lives of the Judge, the Public Prosecutor & the activist's lawyer as the case meanders its away across months courtesy of numerous excuses and delays.

page32.title: Shwaas
page32.description: This story is about how an old man tried to show his grandson the preciousness and beauty of life in a no win situation such as cancer. It is about keeping a positive attitude towards life.

page32.title: Sharyat
page32.description: A man represents the village zamindar and wins the bullock cart races held in his village every single year. One day, everything changes when he suffers an accident while racing because of the evil tactics of a fellow racer.

page32.title: Sanshay Kallol
page32.description: Jay Sinh’s nightmares are made of his wife Asha cheating on him. Asha, on the other hand, is convinced that her fashion photographer husband cheats on her and hasn’t shied of secretly installing a CCTV camera in her husband’s studio.

page32.title: Pune Via Bihar
page32.description: The story of Pune via Bihar has the two states of Maharashtra and Bihar in the backdrop. The film is about the difference of opinion between two cultures. A love story that depicts the bloodless struggle of a couple to unite with each other.

page33.title: I Am Sindhutai Sapkal
page33.description: The film is a biographical account of Sindhutai Sapkal, a woman who became a social activist after a traumatic life. Born in a poor family, Sindhutai was first married off at the age of 12 to a man who was 20 years elder to her and then abandoned by her husband.

page33.title: Majha Navra Tujhi Baiko
page33.description: The film explores the complicated marital lives of two couples. Ankush and Bharat are married and are neighbours. However, both face marital issues and fall in love with each other's wives!

page33.title: Jetaa
page33.description: Yashwant Rajadhyaksha, retired professor of law. At age 65 finds the dormant warrior within on his kurukshetra, which is the legal system. He finds him through his own karmas because that is the only way to find him.

page33.title: Hupa Huiyya
page33.description: Hanmya a poor boy from the village is brought up by the Chief of the village. He helps an old lady by collecting herbs for her medicines from the jungle. One day, he interacts with a group of monkeys and eats a fruit thrown at him by one of the monkeys.

page33.title: Guldasta
page33.description: It revolves around two friends, played by Makarand Anaspure and Jitrenda Joshi and their hilarious attempt to find their individual love, which turns into an ultimate mess.

page33.title: Aevdhe Se Aabhal
page33.description: Estranged from her husband, Shakun has preferred to live in Pune for many a year now. Besides her job, only one thing matters to her, Bunty, her 11-year-old son, who is her only solace in this world.

page34.title: Aaba Jindabad
page34.description: Aaba, an illiterate widower, wants his son to become the most educated person in town. The son, on the contrary, goes astray. Aaba vows to get his son back in his very own way.

page34.title: Katyar Kalijat Ghusali
page34.description: A clash of two musical families, where in the end, music is the winner. When greed takes the front seat, manipulations shift gears. Katyar Kaljat Ghusali depicts the story of the art of music suffering, which is uncannily narrated by a Dagger (Katyar).

page34.title: Prem Mhanje Prem Mhanje Prem Asta
page34.description: The movie focuses on the subject of marriage. It shows how with time the meaning of marriage has undergone changes and evolved. The film is narrated keeping in mind the viewpoint of four generations.

page34.title: Killa
page34.description: A 11-year-old Indian boy who has just lost his father is forced to adapt to a new school in a small village. The story is about how he copes up and how life has to move on transforming a young mind into an adult day by day.

page34.title: Kaksparsh
page34.description: Uma loses her husband at a very young age and faces many hardships. The only support she gets is from her brother-in-law.

page34.title: Tya Ratri Paus Hota
page34.description: A journalist named Avinash raises a question before the politician of the area. Avinash is now kidnapped and sent to the guesthouse where he meets Raavee. They recognize each other and the glimpses of their past have flowed.

page35.title: Timepass
page35.description: A mischievous teen wants to teach a lesson to a man by making his daughter his girlfriend.

page35.title: Timepass 2
page35.description: It is the sequel for the 2014 Marathi movie Timepass. It continues the incomplete love story of Dagadu (Rocky) and Prajakta (Praju).

page35.title: Valu The Wild Bull (Marathi)
page35.description: Swanand Gaddamwa comes to a small village Kusavde to get hold of a bull who was once considered holy by the villagers.

page35.title: Sawar Re
page35.description: A story about the lives of two doting sisters and their mother. Life goes on in normalcy until on the day of the elder sisters Haldi Ceremony, life takes and unprecedented turn, changing the sisters' lives forever, calling for sacrifices and compromises.

page35.title: Taptapadi
page35.description: Based on Rabindranath Tagore's story 'Drushtidaan', the film is the story of a woman who loses her eyesight after marriage and the various issues she faces post that.

page35.title: Pyaar Vali Love Story
page35.description: A love story set against the backdrop of the turbulent times in the 1990s when communal riots had broken out.
